title: How to Place Two Pictures Side by Side

steps.title: Navigate to the PhotoJoiner website at http://www.photojoiner.net/.
steps.content: Navigate to the PhotoJoiner website at http://www.photojoiner.net/ .

steps.title: Click on “Select Photos,” then select the first photo you want used.
steps.content: Click on “Select Photos,” then select the first photo you want used. The photo will display on-screen at PhotoJoiner.

steps.title: Click on “Select Photos” again, then select the second photo you want used.
steps.content: Click on “Select Photos” again, then select the second photo you want used. This photo will display to the right of the first photo.

steps.title: Place a checkmark next to “Margin between images,” if desired.
steps.content: Place a checkmark next to “Margin between images,” if desired. This feature adds a margin to separate the two photos from one another.

steps.title: Click on “Join Photos.
steps.content: Click on “Join Photos. ” Both images will be combined into one solo image.

steps.title: Right-click on the photo and select “Save image as.
steps.content: Right-click on the photo and select “Save image as. ”

steps.title: Type a name for your photo, then click “Save.
steps.content: Type a name for your photo, then click “Save. ” Your side-by-side photo will now be saved.

steps.title: Navigate to the Picisto website at http://www.picisto.com/.
steps.content: Navigate to the Picisto website at http://www.picisto.com/ .

steps.title: Click on “Signup” at the top right corner, then follow the on-screen instructions to create a free account.
steps.content: Click on “Signup” at the top right corner, then follow the on-screen instructions to create a free account. You must sign up for Picisto before you can combine photos using this service.

steps.title: Click on “Side by Side” after logging into Picisto.
steps.content: Click on “Side by Side” after logging into Picisto.

steps.title: Click on “Upload / Choose Photo,” then click “Browse” to select the first photo you want used.
steps.content: Click on “Upload / Choose Photo,” then click “Browse” to select the first photo you want used. The photo will upload and display on the Picisto site. Alternately, you can choose to upload a photo from Facebook, Instagram, URL, or webcam.

steps.title: Click on “Upload / Choose Photo” again, then click “Browse” to select the second photo.
steps.content: Click on “Upload / Choose Photo” again, then click “Browse” to select the second photo. This photo will display to the right of your first photo.

steps.title: Scroll to the bottom of your photo and click “Finish and Save Photo.
steps.content: Scroll to the bottom of your photo and click “Finish and Save Photo. ” Picisto will display a message saying your photo was saved successfully.

steps.title: Scroll to the bottom of your photo and click on “Download.
steps.content: Scroll to the bottom of your photo and click on “Download. ”

steps.title: Select the option to “save” the photo to your desktop.
steps.content: Select the option to “save” the photo to your desktop. Your pictures will now be combined and saved into one solo image.

steps.title: Edit the blog post or page on which you want to feature two pictures side by side.
steps.content: Edit the blog post or page on which you want to feature two pictures side by side.

steps.title: Insert both images separately into your blog post.
steps.content: Insert both images separately into your blog post. Later on, you’ll need to click and drag the images to a different section in the blog post to place them side by side.

steps.title: Click on the “HTML” tab in your post.
steps.content: Click on the “HTML” tab in your post. This is where you’ll paste the code that allows you to feature two images side by side.

steps.content: Click and drag the first photo over to the gray box labeled “photo 1-1. ”
